answers.answer: I use Gabapentin... it helps abit... talk with your Neuro and see what they suggest.take carewobblydx

Hi, and welcome to the forum.  Neuropathic pain is difficult to treat and we were lucky enough to have a pain management doctor wrtie up to Health Pages on the subject.  Please click on the two links below.  the first one is explaining what neuropathic pain is and the second is describing how to treat it and explaining why you want (actually NEED) to go slow.  No one WANTS to go slow, of course.http://www.medhelp.org/health_pages/Multiple%20Sclerosis/Pain---A-Primer/show/371?cid=36http://www.medhelp.org/health_pages/Multiple%20Sclerosis/General-Principles-of-Treating-Neuropathic-Nerve-Pain/show/452?cid=36After you have read these come back and ask any more questions you have.Do you know why you have nerve pain?  MS?  Diabetes?Quix

question: what warks for this pain. it's going on 6 months now.
